result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 79 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.
-09/28/2022 Court amends the JOC to remove the Ignition Interlock Device restriction, as only DOT can order lifetime.

miscConds.notes: -CASH BOND APPLIED, leaving a balance of $193.00. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-CASH BOND APPLIED.  Court costs of $250.00 - PAID IN FULL.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: -Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:17 PM Defendant MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to OWI - 4th offense with probation and conditions. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the alcohol fine enhancer and orders count 2 be dismissed. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court has reviewed the letters. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-5 months county jail. Sentence is to commence immediately. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-DL revocation - lifetime
-IID - lifetime
-AODA (manitowoc)
-$600 fine plus costs, payable within the first year of probation.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Sentence credit - 79 days if revoked.

Court adjourned at 3:32 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI not in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states he has Discovery and an offer and it will resolve and requests a plea date. Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on August 29, 2022 at 2:45 PM.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

records.addlTxt: Return date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:32 AM Defendant MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARTIN D JAROZEWSKI.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the prelim will proceed. State has one witness.

Zachary Plath sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed as a Patrolman for the City of Berlin Police Department. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis. No re-direct by State. State rests. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 8:41 AM

Court will set for Return Date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant  does not waive the time limits.  

Court adjourned at 10:23 AM.

Court schedules Preliminary Hearing for March 29, 2022 at 8:30 AM.
Atty Michael Kapelis
Initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
